problem_text:
16.3. Is it true that if G is a finite group with all conjugacy classes of distinct sizes, then G ∼= S3?
This is true if G is solvable (J. Zhang, J. Algebra, 170 (1994), 608–624); it is also known that F(G) is nontrivial (Z. Arad, M. Muzychuk, A. Oliver, J. Algebra, 280 (2004), 537–576).
Z. Arad
